name: European Union Office of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
membership: The EU Office of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is a member of the European Platform on Religious Intolerance and Discrimination (EPRID), www.eprid.eu
goal:
The operations and initiatives of the Brussels office will fall within the following range of activities:

1. Explore opportunities and challenges related to Freedom of Religion or Belief (FoRB), humanitarian assistance, volunteerism and youths;

2. Contribute to EU policy in the Churchâ€™s fields of interest;

3. Expand, deepen and promote knowledge and expertise on FoRB in Europe;

4. Foster dialogue among opinion leaders, religious leaders, academics and officials engaged in FoRB issues at multi-national organizations and in their home countries.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
The office operations began in September 2013.

2013
- Submitted opinion on the EU Guidelines on Freedom of Expression Online and Offline;

2014
- Church representatives attended EU Commission President's High Level Meeting with Religious Leaders;
- Submitted opinion on "2014 Stakeholder Consultation Procedure";
- Contribution to development for EU officials of freedom of religion or belief (FoRB) trainings;
- Engaged with Parliament committees and contributed to policy making related to human rights and FoRB.
